item.title: Croydon tram crash passenger deaths ruled accidental
item.description: Seven people died when the tram tipped over and spun off the track in Croydon in November 2016.

item.title: Mick Norcross: Former Towie star took his own life, inquest rules
item.description: Mick Norcross was in danger of losing his home and struggled in lockdown, his inquest hears.

item.title: River Dee search: Boy missing after going swimming
item.description: The teenager disappeared after going swimming in the River Dee in Cheshire.

item.title: Pilot praises RAF Lakenheath plane spotter for saving his life
item.description: Ian Simpson alerts an airbase after seeing sparks and flames coming from the rear of a jet.

item.title: Wildfire alert issued for Devon and Cornwall
item.description: The public are being asked to help protect the countryside and avoid activities such as barbecues.

item.title: West Midlands Police chief calls for Test and Trace exemptions
item.description: The high number of West Midlands Police staff self-isolating is making policing "challenging".

item.title: Scarborough beach day trips for Barrowcliff estate children
item.description: A community group has been getting children from Scarborough's Barrowcliff estate to the beach.

item.title: Channel crossings: Hundreds more migrants cross to UK
item.description: The government said a surge in illegal migration across Europe had seen a rise in crossings.

item.title: Tommy Robinson loses Jamal Hijazi libel case
item.description: The High Court orders the anti-Islam activist to pay a teenage refugee Â£100,000 in damages.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Bomb victims felt abandoned, says sister
item.description: The families of victims of the 2017 bombing describe the "horrific" aftermath at Manchester Arena.

item.title: Pistol: Danny Boyle's Sex Pistols drama filmed in Hemel Hempstead
item.description: The director and his crew transform Hemel Hempstead into gritty urban centres for a punk drama.

item.title: Snake owner's warning after 6ft boa constrictor escapes
item.description: Owner Shannon Surch says Bo the snake broke through a vent and escaped via an open window.

item.title: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Driver loses police in wrong-way pursuit in High Wycombe
item.description: The van was seen exceeding 90mph along residential streets and was finally stopped a week later.

item.title: Master distiller brings gin back to home town Henley-upon-Thames
item.description: Jacob Wilson overcame illness to set up the first distillery in Henley in 270 years.

item.title: 'Day After Tomorrow-style' hail in East of England
item.description: Social media users post videos of huge hailstones falling from the sky.

item.title: Hospital cleaner: 'Nobody says thank you'
item.description: Ernesta has been campaigning for better pay and conditions for cleaners during the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: Royal Blackburn Hospital facing huge pressures
item.description: Royal Blackburn Hospital staff say they are feeling the pressure due to a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: North Yorkshire council shake-up will create 'dog's breakfast'
item.description: Merging smaller councils into a single authority will be bad for democracy, a leader warns.

item.title: Malakai Watts death: Mum Chelsea Cuthbertson jailed for manslaughter
item.description: Chelsea Cuthbertson is jailed for nine years for the manslaughter of her baby Malakai Watts.

item.title: Residents of Ipswich flats say cladding repairs affecting health
item.description: Residents of a tower block wrapped in plastic say the lack of light is affecting their health.

item.title: Brixton stabbing: Man killed after 'group confrontation'
item.description: High-end sports cars, thought to be part of a music video being filmed, were seen at the stabbing.

item.title: Firefighters disciplined over secret Santa sex doll
item.description: Firefighters left the inflatable blown up at a station for days and were "crude", it is claimed.

item.title: Govia Thameslink Railway reduces services due to staff isolation
item.description: Govia Thameslink Railway says it has "fewer colleagues available to operate services".

item.title: The Hundred: Oval Invincibles secure entertaining win over Manchester Originals in first men's game
item.description: Oval Invincibles edge out Manchester Originals in an entertaining first men's match of The Hundred at The Oval.

item.title: Super League: Huddersfield Giants 40-26 Hull FC - McGillvary helps hosts end losing run
item.description: Jermaine McGillvary scores four tries as Huddersfield overcome Hull FC to end a seven-game losing Super League run.

item.title: Chelsea cancel Drogheda friendly after 'possible Covid case' in Blues camp
item.description: Chelsea cancel Thursday's pre-season game with Irish side Drogheda after identifying a "possible positive Covid case".

item.title: Durham break records in victory at Kent - One-Day Cup round-up
item.description: Durham break records while Essex, Glamorgan, Leicestershire and Surrey start their One-Day Cup campaigns with wins.

item.title: The Hundred: Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals breaks TV audience record
item.description: The Hundred's opening match, Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals, breaks TV audience record
